alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:11PM CDT until April 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON...CENTRAL FORD AND NORTHWESTERN IROQUOIS COUNTIES... At 711 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Forrest, or near Chatsworth, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Chatsworth around 720 PM CDT. Piper City around 725 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Sibley, Strawn and Thawville. Including the following interstate... I-57 between mile markers 276 and 285. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and east central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
